verses.roman:
'muni', 'nirgrantha', 'ca' 'api',--cāri śabdera artha
yāhāṅ yei lāge, tāhā kariye samartha

synonyms: muni—the sage; nirgrantha—either learned or foolish; ca—also; api—in spite of; cāri śabdera artha—the meanings of these four words; yāhāṅ—wherever; yei lāge—they apply; tāhā kariye samartha—make them sound.
translation: "When these thirty-two types of devotees are qualified with the words muni nirgrantha ca api, they can be increased in different ways and very soundly elaborated upon.
